channel.title: Drugs.com - Daily MedNews
channel.description: Headline news from Drugs.com. Comprehensive and up-to-date drug news for both consumers and healthcare professionals.

item.title: Make Learning Fun, and Kids Learn More
item.description: FRIDAY, Sept. 20, 2019 -- Make it fun, and they will learn. That's the conclusion of a new Canadian study that analyzed a kindergarten teaching program that favors playful activities and socializing over sit-down lectures. In the end, the...

item.title: FDA OKs New Pill for Type 2 Diabetes, Rybelsus (Semaglutide)
item.description: FRIDAY, Sept. 20, 2019 -- A new pill to lower blood sugar for people with type 2 diabetes was approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Friday. The drug, Rybelsus (semaglutide) is the first pill in a class of drugs called glucagon-like...

item.title: Anemia During Pregnancy Tied to Higher Odds for Autism, ADHD in Kids
item.description: FRIDAY, Sept. 20, 2019 -- Women who suffer from anemia early in pregnancy are at risk for having a child with autism, attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and intellectual disabilities, a study by Swedish researchers suggests. The study...

item.title: Flavored E-Cigarettes May Make Asthma Worse
item.description: FRIDAY, Sept. 20, 2019 -- Black licorice, banana pudding and other flavored electronic cigarette liquids may make respiratory diseases like asthma worse, a new international study finds. Vaping has surged in recent years, especially among young...

item.title: Low Vitamin D Levels, Shorter Life?
item.description: FRIDAY, Sept. 20, 2019 -- Young and middle-aged adults with low vitamin D levels may live shorter lives, a large study suggests. The findings come from a 20-year follow-up of more than 78,000 Austrian adults. Researchers found that those with low...

item.title: Sick Americans Turning to Medical Pot for Help
item.description: FRIDAY, Sept. 20, 2019 -- More Americans use marijuana to help them cope with an illness than just to get high, a new study finds. Nearly 46% of those who use pot say they do so because of a medical condition, compared with 22% who say they use...

item.title: Smarter Snacks for Football Fans

item.title: Don't Let Fear of Cancer Keep You From Doctor Visits
item.description: FRIDAY, Sept. 20, 2019 -- As terrified as you might be of a possible cancer diagnosis from your doctor, a new study warns that you still need to keep your appointment. Why? Patients who blow off appointments for cancer symptoms are 12% more likely...

item.description:

item.title: Cases of Vaping-Linked Lung Illness Rise to 530 Across 38 States: CDC
item.description: THURSDAY, Sept. 19, 2019 -- The number of confirmed or suspected severe lung illnesses linked to vaping has leapt to 530 cases across 38 states and the Virgin Islands, U.S. health officials reported Thursday. There have also been seven confirmed...

item.title: Keeping Blood Sugar Steady Helps You Live Longer With Diabetes
item.description: THURSDAY, Sept. 19, 2019 -- If you have type 2 diabetes, keeping your blood sugar levels stable over time may be key to living longer. New research finds that people who have more swings in their blood sugar levels were more than twice as likely to...

item.title: Tiny Genetic Tweak May Stop Ebola Virus in Its Tracks

item.title: Age Often Dampens Narcissists' Self-Love, Study Finds

item.title: Four-Legged Friends Help Buffer Loss of a Spouse
